results.title: Sebastian the fox: the sleepwalkers
results.creator_credit: Tim Burstall, Patrick Ryan and Eltham Films
results.brief_description: Puppet film featuring Sebastian Fox up to his cunning tricks again - disturbing the sleep of two grown-ups. He pulls off the bed-clothes, then frightens them by appearing as a ghost. Finally, Sebastian locks out the couple and takes over the bed. Puppets by Peter Scriven.

results.title: Sebastian the fox: the painter
results.creator_credit: Tim Burstall, Patrick Ryan and Eltham Films
results.brief_description: Sebastian the Fox enters an artist’s studio and does some painting himself, while the artist and his model are having tea. He is made to clear up the mess he makes and told to leave, but Sebastian has his revenge. Photography by Giorgio Manianele.

results.title: Sebastian the fox: the animal catcher
results.brief_description: Another adventure for Sebastian the Fox when he is caught by Professor Catchem, licensed animal catcher and pet shop owner. A young boy decides to buy Sebastian when he sees him in the display window, but Sebastian is too clever and outsmarts the boy and the professor. Puppets by Peter Scriven. Music by George Dreyfus.

results.title: Seaway to the heartland
results.creator_credit: Fred Gorman Films and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: This is the story of the St. Lawrence Seaway, its construction, its operation and its impact on our economy. It gives a brief historical review of the earlier canals, which were built as long as two hundred years ago. Narrated by Bob Gardiner.

results.title: Seawatch
results.creator_credit: Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: A comprehensive view of the Australian Navy in action. The Navy is seen at work both above and below water in a series of exercises that leave little doubt of the strength and ability of Australia’s naval defences for the ‘80’s.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Kingcroft Productions

results.title: Seawards: the great ships
results.creator_credit: Hilary Harris and Templar Film Studios
results.brief_description: This documentary on the life and work of shipbuilders on Scotland’s Clyde River is historically notable as one of the last films on which John Grierson was creatively credited, preparing the outline treatment from which American Hilary Harris worked. Harris, who had previously produced interesting experimental work delivers inventive images and clever editing. Made for the Clyde Shipbuiders Association and the Films of Scotland Committee. Commentary by Bryden Murdoch. (Award: Oscar Best Short Subject/Best Live Action, 1961).

results.title: Seasonal changes in the temperate regions
results.creator_credit: Margaret Simpson, Frank Wells and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: Attention is concentrated on the temperate regions of the earth. These are shown to lie between the Tropical and Polar regions. Owing to the tilting of the earth’s axis and its movement round the sun, the temperature of these regions is very different at opposite times of the year. This point is brought out by examining the position regarding temperature in these regions in June and December. Then the two transitional seasons, in March and September, are also examined.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Margaret Simpson, Frank Wells and Gaumont-British Instructional

results.title: Searchlight on the nations
results.creator_credit: Raymond Spottiswoode, Roger Barlow, Stuart Legg and United Nations. Film Board
results.brief_description: This film deals with the international exchange of information through modern means of communication - press, radio, films, television, telegraph, cablegram. Half the human race does not have yet the means to hear the other half; half the human race remains a prey to superstition, poverty, ignorance, disease, fallacy and distortion of the truth. This is a history of the development of communications and how the UNO is working to break down the barriers to progress and international understanding.

results.title: Search for security
results.creator_credit: Adrian Boddington, Jennie Blackwood, Victoria. Hospitals and Charities Commission and Zanthus Films
results.brief_description: A presentation of the problems facing the aged and the community’s responsibility to them. Shows through the experiences of one elderly lady (played by Lorna Forbes) the services rendered by social workers, district nurses, and “meals on wheels”. Emphasises need for companionship, warmth and comfort, as well as a degree of independence.

results.title: Search for oil
results.brief_description: ‘Search for oil’ explains some of the work involved in oil exploration prior to drilling wells. The technology is becoming increasingly complex as the search becomes more difficult, but the story is told in a simple way using interesting images from around the world with basic non-technical animated drawings. It incorporates examples of the latest advances in the field of seismic exploration.
